name: Home Hotel Buenos Aires

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi there,
reviews.title: Home - An excellent hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed with my husband for a week at the Home hotel. All the reviews are correct and accurate! The staff was extremely friendly and helpful (and all spoke English) all the time. They certainly went "above & beyond" for their guests.
reviews.title: Home Hotel: Believe the Great Reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was spacious, super clean and nice & the bathroom / shower was great. The breakfast was delicious and delightful every day. The location is perfect - several cool restaurants within a block. You are close to the action, with lots of activity and people around. A short walk to trendy stores & outdoor cafes.
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The cocktails at Home were fantastic, light and refreshing. I wish more bars in the US had drinks so amazing.
reviews.title: The Name Says it All

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: It's also one of the few places around with a pool - a great pool and patio area as well. The also have a free computer and internet access in the lobby. No need to bring that laptop!
reviews.title: Oasis

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel based on the joint recommendations of this website and TimeOut...and was not disappointed!!! This hotel is really great!! Swank, hip, modern/zen/minimalistic design, comfortable rooms, friendly staff, and who could beat the price?!?! We loved the made from scratch breakfast provided by the hotel (btw it's not free on weekends), and the spa packages at $45 US per hour are well worth it! They advertise it as the perfect way to settle into BsAs after a 9 hour flight and they are right!!!
reviews.title: AWESOME!!! Would Go Back In A Heartbeat!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: When we were in BsAs, the staff were so helpful in pointing out things to do, places to go, and helping with tours, cars, taxis, etc. We had a problem with our domestic flight on to Puerto Iguazu, and the staff spent nearly an hour on the phone with us to get our reservation changed. They were so helpful...they really went the extra mile. The management really cares about running a quality establishment, and this hotel is truly worthy of your business. We would come back to BsAs just to stay at this hotel!
reviews.title: Loved the neighborhood, hotel was ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Chose to stay at Home based on TA reviews and preference for small, boutique hotels as well as for the neighborhood of Palermo. Loved the neighborhood with its many restaurants and shops. The city center was conveniently reached by the metro stop which was less than a 10 minute walk. The staff were friendly and helpful for the most part, there were few exceptions.
reviews.title: Cannot say enough good things about Home Hotel.

likes.disliked: — Can't think of anything that wasn't done well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself was okay; must admit did not like the ikea-like furniture. We had booked two rooms, both were small and there was a bit of noise factor. Breakfast was an interesting variation from the norm. Free internet access: one computer in the common area.
reviews.title: Comfortable Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant recommendations were excellent. Did try their spa facility with a jet lag massage: not too bad. Tango recommendation: average touristy fare, but that may be the nature of the beast. Enjoyed the street side versions much more.
reviews.title: Missing Home already

likes.disliked: — having to leave when our reservation was up

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at home for a week and we loved everything about it - it has to be out favourite hotel IN THE WORLD!!! I cannot fault it in any way, will be back ASAP. I still dream about lying by the beutiful pool with a passion fruit martini, feeling more relaxed than ever - FAB!
reviews.title: The Perfect Hotel - can't be beaten

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service is above and beyond what we've experienced anywhere we have traveled. On top of that, Palermo Hollywood is a fantastic area to be in. While we did have problems with the construction next door, the staff went well beyond what you'd expect and offered to move us to another hotel. We looked at rooms at the 5 in Soho and Malabia House and decided instead we'd rather stay at Home. The restaurant/bar is terrific and the rooms are really comfortable, upscale and clean. The noise was a bit inconvient but we really enjoyed our stay. If you are considering making a reservation, check and see if the construction is finished and if not, request a room away from that side. Construction aside, this is the best hotel -- and we're not easy customers.
reviews.title: Great service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Whenever a hotel is so universally praised, there is such a high expectation developed that someone is eventually disappointed. I’m sorry to say that I am that person. Don’t get me wrong—Home is a wonderful place to stay. But they do disappoint in some big areas.
reviews.title: Good Hotel -- But Big Problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The reservation process was not “instant” like some websites that tell you availability and confirmation in real time, but my request was promptly followed by a nice email from “Lucas” who confirmed the details of my reservation. I wrote Lucas asking for the best way to get to the hotel and he replied that he would arrange car service from the airport as this would be the most convenient method for me to quickly get to the hotel after a long flight by not having to negotiate or wait in line for a taxicab. $80 + tolls I was told. This was a bit more than the $60 that is the usual rate quoted by locals, but I agreed the convenience would be worth it.
reviews.title: The place to stay in B.A!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I arrived at EZE there was no car or driver holding a namecard with my name in sight. I looked for half an hour and then called the hotel. They asked me to wait on the phone while they sorted things out and eventually a driver came to the phone booth and introduced himself. He asked me to wait for the car. I sat and waited. All told, 45 minutes passed by before I was even able to start my journey to the hotel.
reviews.title: What a joy!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you stay in Buenos Aires, we can't recommend enough that this is the place to stay!
reviews.title: FANTASTIC!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: Staff are friendly & efficient at all times (including prior to our arrival - thank you Sonia on the front desk).
reviews.title: No place like Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: A warm, smiley welcome awaits. Decor is minimalist, tasteful & creates a very serene & restful ambiance - most welcome when returning after a day's sightseeing.
reviews.title: Great place to stay.

likes.liked: — service, location, affordability and hotel design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Try the spa, especially on arrival after a very long flight (best massage ever by Cintia) - most welcome.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff make you feel that absolutely nothing is too much trouble and they are there to please - if there was an award for asking the most questions, we would have won it. And yet they still seemed sorry to see us leave! The front desk were a great help in ensuring we had a good experience in BA.
reviews.title: low-rate hostel..don't bother!

description: Winner of 2007 Best New Hotel Award by Wallpaper* Magazine, Home Hotel set the benchmark for all other boutique hotels in Argentina since it opened in 2005. The interior design is modern with a hint of retro, with original 50´s and 60´s pieces and bespoke furniture. Touches of warmth are given by the use of original vintage wallpapers, natural textures and plenty of green provided by its lush garden with outdoor heated pool. Its restaurant, cocktail bar and spa make Home a green oasis in the middle of the city.
